title: Discounted RP Cards - Are they legal?

embed.description: G2A.COM - digital games marketplace for everyone

body:
G2A is clearing out massively on RP cards and other cheap games, but is it legal? 

(almost half price, link above for those interested)

replies.body: G2A is a dodgy company/website, there were many reports where the products they sold were invalid due to regional etc. This should not be trusted unless you know they had partnered and struck a deal to do this, e.g like Steam Card having a sale (even though it is american based and prices are different).
I'd take ^ his word over mine honestly. Better safe than sorry.

DO NOT QUOTE ME ON THIS I KNOW NOTHING FOR SURE.

G2A is a company I've seen around and I do believe they are legitimate. If they are having sales on RP cards it is likely because they have a lot of overstock that are about to expire and they're trying to get some of what they paid for them back. They would likely be losing money on that deal. As for the games themselves, I believe they have deals sorta like steam does to be able to put them on sale and that on occasion they will put up massive sales to draw attention/presence.

If you google around a bit, I'm sure you'll find plenty of people asking the same and you will probably get decent answers. That's all I know about it I'm afraid. Good luck!
